cards.front:
Oxygen and carbon dioxide pass across the alveolar membrane in the lungs through a process called:

(See The Respiratory System: Physiology)

The axial skeleton is composed of the:

(See The Skeletal System: Anatomy)
cards.back: skull, face, thorax, and vertebral column.

cards.front:

(See The Circulatory System: Physiology)

(See Topographic Anatomy)

(See The Skeletal System: Anatomy)

(See The Digestive System: Anatomy)

Skeletal muscle is also called:

(See The Musculoskeletal System: Anatomy)

As the bronchus divides into smaller bronchioles, the terminal ends of these smaller passages form the:

(See The Respiratory System: Anatomy)

(See The Circulatory System: Anatomy)

(See The Circulatory System: Anatomy)

The electrical impulse of the heart normally begins at the:

(See The Skeletal System: Anatomy)

Dead space is the portion of the respiratory system that:

(See The Respiratory System: Physiology)
cards.back: contains no alveoli and does not participate in gas exchange.
